name: Automated Slack Channel Inactivity Audit & Report Generator for Workspace Cleanup

user.name: Trung Tran
user.bio: Empowering small and medium businesses with smart automation and practical AI, no big tech team required.

description:
# Automated Slack Channel Audit Workflow with Chatbot and GPT-4.1
![](https://wisestackai.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/slack-channel-inactivity-report-workflow.jpg)
> Automatically scans all public Slack channels weekly to detect those with no activity in the past 30 days, then generates and sends a detailed inactivity report to admins for review and action. Helps keep your Slack workspace clean, relevant, and clutter-free.

## üßë‚Äçüíº Who‚Äôs it for

This workflow is built for:
- **Slack Workspace Admins**
- **IT or Ops Managers**
- **HR/Compliance Teams**
‚Ä¶who want to maintain a clean and active Slack workspace by regularly reviewing **inactive channels**.

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it works / What it does

This automated n8n workflow:
1. **Runs weekly** via a scheduled trigger.
2. **Fetches all public Slack channels** in the workspace.
3. **Checks message history** of each channel for activity.
4. **Filters channels** that have had **no discussion in the past 30 days**.
5. **Generates a Slack-friendly report** with key metadata (name, member count, purpose, etc.).
6. **Sends the report to a Slack channel** for admin review and possible action (e.g., archive, engage, repurpose).

## üõ†Ô∏è How to set up

1. **Configure your Slack App**
   - Go to https://api.slack.com/apps ‚Üí Create App
   - Add the following **OAuth scopes** to your **Bot Token**:
     - `channels:read` ‚Üí to get list of public channels
     - `channels:history` ‚Üí to fetch message history
     - `users:read` ‚Üí to personalize report (optional)
     - `chat:write` ‚Üí to post the report to a Slack channel

2. **Install the app in your workspace**  
   - Copy the **Bot User OAuth Token**  
   - Add it to your n8n Slack credentials under "Slack API"

3. **Customize the schedule** in the "Weekly Schedule Trigger" node to control report frequency.

4. **Connect your Slack workspace** to the workflow using your credentials.

## ‚úÖ Requirements

- n8n (self-hosted or cloud)
- Slack App with:
  - `channels:read`
  - `channels:history`
  - `chat:write`
- Active channels and member data
- A designated Slack channel to receive the report

## üîß How to customize the workflow

| Component | Customization Options |
|----------|------------------------|
| ‚è±Ô∏è Schedule Trigger | Change to daily, monthly, etc. |
| üìÖ Inactivity Threshold | Modify `Filter channel with last discussion 30 days ago` to 60/90 days |
| üìä Report Formatting | Tweak the `Consume slack report` node to change formatting or summary |
| üí¨ Output Channel | Change target channel in `Send Channel Inactivity Report` |
| üö´ Auto-archiving | Add logic to archive channels with 0 members or activity (using Slack API) |

## üìù Slack Permissions Reference

| Action | Slack Scope Required |
|--------|-----------------------|
| Get all public channels | `channels:read` |
| Get message history of a channel | `channels:history` |
| Post message to Slack | `chat:write` |
| Get user info (optional) | `users:read` |

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

parameters.content:
# Automated Slack Channel Audit Workflow with Chatbot and GPT-4.1
![](https://wisestackai.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/slack-channel-inactivity-report-workflow.jpg)
> Automatically scans all public Slack channels weekly to detect those with no activity in the past 30 days, then generates and sends a detailed inactivity report to admins for review and action. Helps keep your Slack workspace clean, relevant, and clutter-free.

## üßë‚Äçüíº Who‚Äôs it for

This workflow is built for:
- **Slack Workspace Admins**
- **IT or Ops Managers**
- **HR/Compliance Teams**
‚Ä¶who want to maintain a clean and active Slack workspace by regularly reviewing **inactive channels**.

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it works / What it does

This automated n8n workflow:
1. **Runs weekly** via a scheduled trigger.
2. **Fetches all public Slack channels** in the workspace.
3. **Checks message history** of each channel for activity.
4. **Filters channels** that have had **no discussion in the past 30 days**.
5. **Generates a Slack-friendly report** with key metadata (name, member count, purpose, etc.).
6. **Sends the report to a Slack channel** for admin review and possible action (e.g., archive, engage, repurpose).

## üõ†Ô∏è How to set up

1. **Configure your Slack App**
   - Go to https://api.slack.com/apps ‚Üí Create App
   - Add the following **OAuth scopes** to your **Bot Token**:
     - `channels:read` ‚Üí to get list of public channels
     - `channels:history` ‚Üí to fetch message history
     - `users:read` ‚Üí to personalize report (optional)
     - `chat:write` ‚Üí to post the report to a Slack channel

2. **Install the app in your workspace**  
   - Copy the **Bot User OAuth Token**  
   - Add it to your n8n Slack credentials under "Slack API"

3. **Customize the schedule** in the "Weekly Schedule Trigger" node to control report frequency.

4. **Connect your Slack workspace** to the workflow using your credentials.

## ‚úÖ Requirements

- n8n (self-hosted or cloud)
- Slack App with:
  - `channels:read`
  - `channels:history`
  - `chat:write`
- Active channels and member data
- A designated Slack channel to receive the report

## üîß How to customize the workflow

| Component | Customization Options |
|----------|------------------------|
| ‚è±Ô∏è Schedule Trigger | Change to daily, monthly, etc. |
| üìÖ Inactivity Threshold | Modify `Filter channel with last discussion 30 days ago` to 60/90 days |
| üìä Report Formatting | Tweak the `Consume slack report` node to change formatting or summary |
| üí¨ Output Channel | Change target channel in `Send Channel Inactivity Report` |
| üö´ Auto-archiving | Add logic to archive channels with 0 members or activity (using Slack API) |

## üìù Slack Permissions Reference

| Action | Slack Scope Required |
|--------|-----------------------|
| Get all public channels | `channels:read` |
| Get message history of a channel | `channels:history` |
| Post message to Slack | `chat:write` |
| Get user info (optional) | `users:read` |

### 1. ‚è∞ Weekly Schedule Trigger
Starts the workflow on a recurring schedule (e.g., every Monday at 9 AM) to automate the review process without manual intervention.

### 2. üì° Get Many Channels
Fetches a list of all public Slack channels in the workspace using Slack‚Äôs `channels:read` scope.

### 3. üïì Get the History of a Channel
Retrieves recent message history from each channel using Slack‚Äôs `channels:history` scope. This helps determine when the last discussion occurred.

### 4. üö´ Filter Channels with No Activity in 30 Days
Filters out channels that have had no messages or discussion in the last 30 days. These are considered "expired" or inactive.

### 5. üì¶ Collect Expired Channel Information
Extracts relevant metadata for each inactive channel, including:
- Channel ID and name
- Member count
- Created date
- Purpose

This data is prepared for reporting.

### 6. üìù Consume Slack Report
Generates a clean and Slack-friendly Markdown report (or code block format) listing all inactive channels with contextual recommendations.

### 7. üì§ Send Channel Inactivity Report
Posts the formatted report to a specified Slack channel using `chat:write`, notifying admins or moderators to take cleanup action.
